html.body: This process models the agent's nonverbal idle behavior depending on its participant role and the progress status of the dialog pipeline.
Create a new pipeline data for the next turn. Here we use the initial meta data for each turn. This method puts the meta-data as JSON object to the pipeline data and assigns a new id to the turn.
We receive the user's speech input and from that moment on we are planning the response.
Here we post an abort signal to the avatar service in order to abort the avatar's speech and animations.
Here the user takes the turn by starting talking.
Her the user releases the turn by stopping talking.
We await the meta data from the user interface configuration and we start the model after we have received the meta data.
Here we print the meta data to the console for debugging puposes.
